bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 19, 1916

div1.p: Blue informs Carter that the dates for the lectures on yellow fever and malaria are satisfactory.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 19, 1916
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
CD
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 19, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to your letter of the 17th instant, you
are informed that the dates mentioned in your letter,
namely, January 24, 26, and 29, for the delivery of
lectures on yellow fever and malaria to the student
class at the Hygienic Laboratory, are satisfactory
to the Bureau. The necessary orders will be issued
without delay.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. J
